BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of correction, in coordination with the commissioner of health and mental hygiene, to post a quarterly report on its website regarding punitive segregation, restricted housing and clinical alternative to punitive segregation housing statistics for city jails
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of correction, in coordination with the commissioner of health and mental hygiene, to post a quarterly report on its website regarding punitive segregation, restricted housing and clinical alternative to punitive segregation hou

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Correction to end the practice of placing individuals returning to City jails into punitive segregation, also known as solitary confinement, to complete time owed.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Dept of Correction to end the practice of placing individuals returning to City jails into punitive segregation, also known as solitary confinement, to complete time owed.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of correction, in coordination with the commissioner of health and mental hygiene, to post a quarterly report on its website regarding punitive segregation, restricted housing and clinical alternative to punitive segregation housing statistics for city jails

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Amended by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of correction, in coordination with the commissioner of health and mental hygiene, to post a quarterly report on its website regarding punitive segregation, restricted housing and clinical alternative to punitive segregation hou

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Correction to end the practice of placing individuals returning to City jails into punitive segregation, also known as solitary confinement, to complete time owed.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Dept of Correction to end the practice of placing individuals returning to City jails into punitive segregation, also known as solitary confinement, to complete time owed.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Rodriguez and Dromm

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
